image.altText: For Sale signage outside a suburban house.

items.synopsis: New research shows more than 25 per cent of homes sold in Queensland, Victoria and NSW were paid for in cash by older Australians who have benefited from high property prices and are "basically immune" to the effects of rising interest rates.

title.children: With another interest rate rise, there's a large group of home buyers 'immune' from its impacts

image.altText: Before and after images show the flood damage

items.synopsis: Satellite images show the extent of the damage as one of the biggest reservoirs of water in the world drains across war-ravaged Ukraine.

title.children: A flood of biblical proportions: Southern Ukraine will be inundated with 36 Sydney Harbours in days

image.altText: Performers taking part in an art show.

items.synopsis: The latest "blatant agenda to bring hell to earth" in sleepy old Hobart is about to kick off — and, true to form, has timed the pressing of the outrage button to perfection.

title.children: Dark Mofo does it again with outrage summoned on command

image.altText: Two firefighters in full protective equipment use a fire hose on burning scrub as smoke billows through nearby trees.

items.synopsis: A merger between Tasmania Fire Service and the State Emergency Service has drawn criticism, with former fire chiefs saying it will create "dangerous" levels of bureaucracy. Last week, the TFS chief officer quit his post over the concerns.

title.children: Former fire chiefs fear 'dangerous' emergency reforms in lead up to next bushfire season

image.altText: A top golf executive sits at a desk in front of a microphone and looks out at reporters at a press conference.

items.synopsis: News of a PGA Tour-LIV Golf union shook the sport to its core, but the unseemly truth is the real merger is with the Saudi Arabian Public Investment Fund, and will likely spell the end for LIV.

title.children: There is no PGA Tour-LIV Golf merger. The truth is much darker than that

image.altText: A man wearing all black walks along a line of other men, also wearing black.

items.synopsis: The federal government says it will introduce legislation to ban Nazi symbols and the sale of goods-for-profit featuring Nazi symbols.

title.children: Federal government set to introduce national ban on Nazi symbols

image.altText: A woman crouched down in front of a fridge holding up a bag of rotten food.

items.synopsis: The state forced Katelyn apart from her mother, who has dementia, for two years. She says her mother was left without important medical care as her guardian struggled to manage an excessive workload.

title.children: Katelyn's mother is under state care. They left her heart monitor disconnected for 18 months

image.altText: A RAAF F/A-18 taxis on a runway in Katherine.

items.synopsis: Kyiv assures the White House that it would not deploy second-hand Australian warplanes into Russian airspace if dozens of the retired F/A-18s are transferred to Ukraine.

title.children: Retired Australian fighter jets a step closer to joining Ukraine's war effort, but obstacles remain

image.altText: A composite image of Jim Chalmers and Philip Lowe.

items.synopsis: It's not just stretched borrowers being pushed closer to breaking point. The consensus between the treasurer and the RBA governor is also cracking – at least when it comes to the impact wages are having on inflation, writes David Speers.

title.children: When it comes to inflation and wages, Chalmers and Lowe diverge on one pivotal point

image.altText: A young Aboriginal man standing on an outback runway in front of a small aircraft and looking serious.

items.synopsis: In some of Australia's most remote communities, where many don't speak English as a first language, an Indigenous community broadcaster is reaching out to learn residents' views about the Indigenous Voice to Parliament ahead of the referendum.

title.children: Damien has travelled Australia talking to communities about the Voice. Here's what he found

image.altText: Former Vice President Mike Pence speaks at a Coolidge and the American Project luncheon.

items.synopsis: Mike Pence has become the first US vice-president in modern history to challenge the president under whom he served.

title.children: Donald Trump 'should never be president': Mike Pence slams former boss at campaign launch

image.altText: A yellow dot on a map of northern Australia indicating where an earthquake hit

items.synopsis: Two strong tremors have rocked Far North Queensland and northern NSW overnight with a 'reasonably significant' 4.3 magnitude and a 3.1 magnitude earthquake rattling homes.

title.children: Twin earthquakes rattle Australia's east coast

image.altText: Young female bartender pulls a pint

items.synopsis: Australians aren't drinking like we used to. Yet, despite parallels to tobacco use, some experts say alcohol's history and place in society mean it'll remain indefinitely.

title.children: Why this expert says we'll always drink, even when we know it's harmful for us

image.altText: A young woman with red lipstick smiles while hugging her grandmother

items.synopsis: Around one in three families has multiple generations living under the same roof. Cost of living could see that figure increase.

title.children: Young people are moving back in with their families — and it's not just them benefitting from it

image.altText: A white car on a grass verge at night with its boot up and a green bin and police tape in the foreground.

items.synopsis: A police officer is in critical condition after being run over by a car that was being pursued in Ascot in Perth's eastern suburbs overnight.

title.children: Police officer critical after being run over and dragged under car following Perth pursuit

image.altText: Large white blades and trailers, there's a truck on highway

items.synopsis: Drivers are warned to expect delays as hundreds of wind turbine parts are carefully transported to a renewable energy project south of Kojonup.

title.children: Gigantic wind farm blades on 350-kilometre journey across WA's South West

image.altText: Canada wildfire US

items.synopsis: Smoke from Canadian wildfires pours into the US East Coast and Midwest, covering the capitals of both nations in an unhealthy haze.

title.children: New York City air pollution eight times higher than normal after being blanketed in smoke from Canadian wildfires

image.altText: Orange smoke rising from lava in volcano crater.

items.synopsis: Kilauea, one of the most active volcanoes in the world, began erupting after a three-month pause, displaying spectacular fountains of mesmerising, glowing lava.

title.children: Webcam captures spectacular images of burning lava as Kilauea volcano erupts in Hawaii

image.altText: The ASX close to steady in early trade as seen on the exchange's board at its Sydney office

items.synopsis: The ASX200 is expected to lose ground this morning, while economists warn that a recession has become likelier for Australia.

title.children: ASX expected to lose ground on opening, as recession warnings get louder

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Good morning everyone, Australia's sharemarket lost ground on Wednesday, and the futures index suggests that negative momentum will continue this morning when trading begins. This week we've seen the Reserve Bank lift the cash rate target to 4.1 per cent, and the Bureau of Statistics released its March quarter GDP figures that showed the Bank's rate rises biting economic activity in the first three months of this year. Economists are still absorbing the news, and there's an increasing number of economists warning that it will be difficult to avoid a recession in Australia. Some have also changed their forecasts for the cash rate, with a few now thinking the RBA won't stop lifting rates until the cash rate hits 4.85%. That means they expect to see three more hikes of 0.25 percentage points from here. It's fair to say that type of warning has changed the mood in Australia, and RBA governor Philip Lowe saying people shouldn't fall into "a state of despair" because the labour market is still so strong. But we'll see what analysts say today, now they've had more time to absorb the news.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Market update: economy turning?

children.content: Australia's sharemarket lost ground on Wednesday, and the futures index suggests that negative momentum will continue this morning when trading begins.

This week we've seen the Reserve Bank lift the cash rate target to 4.1 per cent, and the Bureau of Statistics released its March quarter GDP figures that showed the Bank's rate rises biting economic activity in the first three months of this year.
Economists are still absorbing the news, and there's an increasing number of economists warning that it will be difficult to avoid a recession in Australia.
Some have also changed their forecasts for the cash rate, with a few now thinking the RBA won't stop lifting rates until the cash rate hits 4.85%.
That means they expect to see three more hikes of 0.25 percentage points from here.

It's fair to say that type of warning has changed the mood in Australia, and RBA governor Philip Lowe saying people shouldn't fall into "a state of despair" because the labour market is still so strong.
But we'll see what analysts say today, now they've had more time to absorb the news.

image.altText: Rory shoots 8-over

items.synopsis: Four-time major champion and LIV Golf critic Rory McIlroy says he feels like a "sacrificial lamb" as details of the "merger" with the PGA emerge.

title.children: 'Sacrificial lamb': McIlroy responds to golf 'merger' as Norman says LIV Golf is here to stay

image.altText: David Warner looks to one side

items.synopsis: David Warner answers some more of his critics, India misreads the pitch, wins a bad toss and drops the world's best bowler, and Travis Head re-invents the Baz-ball reinvention.

title.children: Five things we learnt at the WTC Final: From Warner's good start to the emergence of Trav-ball

image.altText: A woman holds her hand to ear to get the crowd to cheer louder.

items.synopsis: Polish star Iga Swiatek sees off Coco Gauff, as Beatriz Haddad Maia becomes the first Brazilian woman since 1968 to reach a grand slam semifinal.

title.children: Iga Swiatek dominates American again, as Brazilian breaks 55-year grand slam hoodoo

image.altText: The exterior of a fire truck.

items.synopsis: As many as 77 people were evacuated before take-off at Moranbah in central Queensland on Wednesday evening after a fire was found in the tail of their charter flight.

title.children: Dozens evacuated from charter flight at regional airport as fire breaks out

image.altText: a man cuddles his dog in the doorway of his home

items.synopsis: Jukka Manttari is pain-free for the first time in 30 years thanks to medicinal cannabis, but the cost of treatments is crippling him financially.

title.children: 'I would have done anything': Jukka finally found a way to manage his chronic pain. It costs half his pension

image.altText: A young woman with short blonde hair sits on a green chair in a cafe, resting her head against the dark window.

items.synopsis: The No Time to Die actor plays a 40-something widow juggling care duties and desire in the erotically charged, lyrical drama One Fine Morning.

title.children: Léa Seydoux is a single mum caught between a steamy affair and her ailing father in new drama

image.altText: Vladimir Putin chairs meeting

items.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin says the destruction of the Kakhovka dam is an "environmental and humanitarian catastrophe" during a call with Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.

title.children: Putin calls dam breach a 'catastrophe', Ukraine says it's made advances in Bakhmut

image.altText: Italy's former prime minister Giuseppe Conte wears a face mask with the Italian flag printed on.

items.synopsis: An Italian court on Wednesday dropped a case against former prime minister Giuseppe Conte and former health minister Roberto Speranza over their initial handling of the COVID-19 pandemic, a court document said.

title.children: Italian court drops COVID case which investigated former PM Conte for manslaughter and mishandling the pandemic

image.altText: Harry and Chelsy

items.synopsis: Giving evidence for the second day in court, Prince Harry says he found a tracking device on the car of former girlfriend Chelsy Davy.

title.children: Prince Harry says he found a tracker on Chelsy Davy's car during press storm

image.altText: Forensic experts work with several bags of human remains extracted from the bottom of a ravine by a helicopter.

items.synopsis: As many as eight young workers are confirmed dead in Mexico after they apparently tried to quit jobs at a call centre operated by a violent drug cartel that targeted Americans in a real estate scam.

title.children: Human remains found in bags are missing call centre staff, Mexican authorities confirmed

image.altText: Nine women stand on a boat wearing wetsuits.

items.synopsis: A group of First Nations women are taking a lead role in marine conservation with a new program teaching them to identify marine species and survey the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: First Nations women take lead role in marine conservation
